Hi Jim, here is my attempt

Interesting guard. There is an almost identical one in the Sasano 
Masterpiece book, under Owari. but the work on that guard is a little 
finer. Also, this kantei piece is quite thick for the average Owari work 
but that won't preclude it for me. However, with the very strong 
carving, it's thickness, tekkotsu and and elongated seppa dai, I will 
for either go for Early Edo Kaneyama, or Late Muromachi/Momoyama Owari. 
I am tempted to go for the Kaneyama kantei.

My bid is Early Edo Kaneyama.

Cheers

Rich Turner



Jim Gilbert wrote:
> OK, here is a guard for kantei:
>
> http://ph.groups.yahoo.com/group/nihontostudy/photos/browse/2964?c
>
> 77.0 mm H x 74.8 mm W, 7.2 mm thick at the mimi and 7.1 mm thick at the seppa dai.
>
>
> As far as I know it has not been published, but it has been exhibited at a couple of study meetings.  So, if you've already seen it and remember the attribution, please don't post the answer to the list.  It is mumei and there are two almost equally reasonable attributions, but I think that there is more evidence for one than the other.
>
> Respond with your bid on or off list as you prefer.
>
> Jim
>
>
